sentence.text: In particular, angiogenesis mutations result in congenital macrothrombocytopenia and predispose to kidney failure, hearing loss, and cataracts, MPL and MECOM mutations cause congenital thrombocytopenia evolving into bone marrow failure, whereas thrombocytopenias caused by RUNX1, negative regulation of fat cell differentiation, and negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II mutations are characterized by predisposition to hematological malignancies.

entity.text: negative regulation of fat cell differentiation
negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
